intro: Eriocoma thurberiana, commonly known as Thurber's eriocoma, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. Its foliage is covered in a dense layer of fine, white hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. This species is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and unique adaptations to harsh environmental conditions.
